SITE_COMMENT: Reference site selected upstream from the waste rock to represent the local background of the area. Estimated from Figure 1.
Manmade precipitation pond built to catch acidic seepage waters originating from the alum shale waste rock. Liming has allegedly been periodically applied to increase pH. Estimated from Figure 1.

Area where the precipitation pond is connected to the stream through a manmade canal. During sampling campaigns, levels of precipitation were low, and no visible surface water overflow was observed between the pond and stream. Estimated from Figure 1.
Sampling point selected downstream from the deposit to investigate the impact of dilution. Estimated from Figure 1.
